intro: Plectritis congesta var. major, commonly known as the purplehead or purpletop, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and showy, clustered umbels of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of soil types. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
